column2: KENTUCKY PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Kentucky
column6: KY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Do not pass
column6: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
column8: Do not enter

column2: 2. If you encounter an aggressive driver you should:
column4: speed up.
column6: get out of their way.
column8: show them how to drive defensively.

column2: 3. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column6: honk your horn and proceed with caution.
column8: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.

column2: 4. When changing lanes, drivers should identify a ____ second gap in traffic.
column4: 4 to 5
column6: 2 to 3
column8: 3 to 4

column2: 5. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column4: not to drink over a period of time.
column6: fresh air.
column8: drinking coffee.

column2: 6. The amount of alcohol in the blood is measured by:
column4: blood alcohol concentration (BAC).
column6: Amount of Alcohol Drunk (AAD).
column8: Number of Drinks (NOC).

column2: 7. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must not drive past this sign.
column6: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column8: they must turn around immediately.

column2: 8. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: delay near it.
column6: cut abruptly in front of it.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 9. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: NO TURN ON RED.
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 10. A broken yellow line on your side of the roadway only means:
column4: Passing is permitted on both sides.
column6: Passing is not permitted on either side.
column8: Passing is permitted on your side of the roadway.

column2: 11. When being passed by another vehicle, drivers should:
column4: maintain a constant speed.
column6: slow down.
column8: slightly increase their speed.

column2: 12. When driving in fog, you should never use your high beams because:
column4: vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
column6: the light will reflect back into your eyes.
column8: oncoming vehicles might not see you.

column2: 13. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column4: Destination signs (guide signs)
column6: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column8: Warning signs

column2: 14. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Rely on your mirrors.
column6: Look through your back window for children.
column8: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 15. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column6: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column8: Wait for the next green light.

column2: 16. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: on the opposite side of the street.
column6: in a marked crosswalk.
column8: if you have the green light.

column2: 17. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Diamond
column6: Upside-down triangle
column8: Octagon

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.

column2: 19. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Do not enter
column6: Lane ends
column8: No left turn

column2: 21. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column6: on public roads
column8: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 22. When passing another vehicle, you should:
column4: drive at the same speed as the vehicle you are passing.
column6: check your mirrors and blind spots.
column8: assume the other vehicle will maintain a constant speed.

column2: 23. Large trucks:
column4: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
column6: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.
column8: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.

column2: 24. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column6: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
column8: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.

column2: 25. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Stop.
column6: Slow down.
column8: Yield.

column2: 26. When you are angry or upset you should:
column4: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.
column6: drive fast to let off steam.
column8: listen to loud music while driving.

column2: 27. BAC is:
column4: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the acronym for Beer ACcumulation.

column2: 28. Always driving slower than other traffic:
column4: is a good defensive driving technique.
column6: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.
column8: can block traffic.

column2: 29. If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
column4: pump the brakes rapidly.
column6: slow down gradually and brake lightly.
column8: apply the brakes firmly.

column2: 30. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column6: Warning signs (diamond)
column8: Guide signs (horizontal rectangle)

column2: 31. To make a proper right turn:
column4: swing to the left before turning right.
column6: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.
column8: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.

column2: 32. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic must move only in the direction of the arrow
column6: Minimum Speed
column8: Two way Traffic

column2: 34. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 35. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 36. To reduce road rage, you should:
column4: use your horn frequently to warn other drivers.
column6: talk on your cell phone while driving.
column8: always signal your intention when changing lanes.

column2: 37. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 38. Your Driver’s License will:
column4: expire after five years of issuance.
column6: never expire.
column8: expire on your birthday.

column2: 39. This sign means:
column4: Hairpin corner ahead.
column6: Warning: U-turn ahead.
column8: Sharp right turn ahead.

column2: 40. It is unlawful­ to:
column4: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.
column6: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.
column8: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.
